articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Greeting to Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Syrian President
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria and regional secretary of the Arab Baath Socialist Party, on the 41st anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to you and the friendly Syrian people on the occasion.
					
					 The corrective movement conducted under the leadership of Hafez Al-Assad was an event of historic significance for the Syrian people in their struggle to build a prosperous new society.
					
					 Hoping that you and your government would achieve successes in the work for defending the country's sovereignty, security and stability, I sincerely wish you good health and happiness and the Syrian people steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Syrian President
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria, on the 41st anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
					
					Kim in the message heartily wished the Syrian people steady success in safeguarding the country's peace and stability and achieving the socio-economic development under the correct leadership of the President.

articles.title: Chinese Military Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Chinese Military Delegation Arrives

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the General Political Department of the CPLA, arrived here Tuesday by a chartered plane. 
					
					 The delegation included Lieut. Gen. Ding Jiye, deputy director of the CPLA General Logistics Department, Lieut. Gen. Chen Xiaogong,  deputy commander of the Air Force, Lieut. Gen. Wang Dengping, political commissar of the North Sea Fleet of the Navy,  Lieut. Gen. Zhao Zongqi, chief of the Staff of the Jinan Military Area,  Major General Kan Likui, vice-director of the Operation Department of the General Staff of the CPLA, Major General Ci Guowei, deputy director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defense, Major General Li Fengshan, deputy secretary-general of the General Office of the General Political Department of the CPLA, and other general officers and officers.
					
					 It was met at the airport by general officers and officers of the Korean People's Army and the ambassador and the military, naval air attache of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 A welcome ceremony took place in front of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower. 
					
					 Attending it were the Chinese delegation and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai, Sun Yanfeng, military, naval air attache, and staff members of the Chinese embassy. Also present were Kim Jong Gak, member of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, General Pak Jae Gyong and other KPA generals and officers.
					
					 Kim Jong Gak and Li Jinai reviewed a guard of honor of the KPA.
					
					 Li Jinai was presented with bouquets by a KPA servicewoman and  a woman of the Chinese embassy.

articles.title: Head of CPLA Delegation's Arrival Speech
articles.content:
Head of CPLA Delegation's Arrival Speech

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, made public a written speech on his arrival in Pyongyang Tuesday.
					
					 I, on behalf of the Chinese people and army, extend heartfelt greetings and best wishes to the Korean people and army, he said in the speech, adding:
					
					 We are happy to witness the fact that the traditional China-DPRK friendship, forged and cultivated by leaders of the elder generation of the two countries, has made fresh development under the deep care of General Secretary Hu Jintao and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In recent years, exchanges of high-level visits have been brisk between the two countries and important common understanding reached on a series of matters including the development of bilateral friendly and cooperative relations.
					
					 My current visit to the DPRK as head of the delegation is aimed to carry into practice the common understanding achieved by party and army leaders of the two countries and consolidate the existing friendly and cooperative relations between the two peoples and the two armies, in particular.
					
					 We will, together with Korean comrades, strive for regional and global peace, stability and development, thus making new contribution.
					
					 We heartily wish that the Korean people and army would register greater successes in various fields under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Talks between Military Delegations of DPRK, China Held
articles.content:
Talks between Military Delegations of DPRK, China Held
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegation of the Korean People's Army and the high-ranking delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army were held in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Kim Jong Gak, member of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and first vice-director of the KPA General Political Bureau, Gen. Pak Jae Gyong, and other generals and officers of the KPA and from the Chinese side Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the CPLA General Political Department, Lieut. Gen. Ding Jiye, deputy director of the CPLA General Logistics Department, Lieut. Gen. Chen Xiaogong, deputy commander of the Air Force, and other generals and officers of the CPLA and Ambassador Liu Hongcai and Military, Naval and Air Attache Sun Yanfeng of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the matter of boosting the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two armies and matters of mutual concern. 
					
					 The talks proceeded in a comradely and friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: CPLA Delegation Feted
articles.content:
CPLA Delegation Feted
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army on Tuesday hosted a reception in honor of the high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (CPLA) on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation headed by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the CPLA General Political Department, and Ambassador Liu Hongcai and Military, Naval and Air Attache Sun Yanfeng of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Kim Jong Gak, member of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and first vice-director of the KPA General Political Bureau, General Pak Jae Gyong, Lieut. Gen. Kim Su Hak and other generals and officers of the KPA were on hand.
					
					 Addressing the reception, Kim Jong Gak said that the visit by the delegation this year when the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance was jointly and significantly celebrated would mark an important occasion in promoting the friendship between the armies of the two countries on a high level.
					
					 He went on to say:
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship, provided by President Kim Il Sung together with elder revolutionaries of China, is now greeting its new heyday under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 We will, together with Chinese comrades, strive to further strengthen this long-standing friendship in line with the intention of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 He wished the Chinese army and people greater success in their efforts to build socialism with Chinese characteristics and strengthen the revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 Li Jinai said in his speech that China and the DPRK are neighboring states lined by a mountain and rivers and traditional Sino-DPRK friendly relations are developing generation after generation. 
					
					 The precious Sino-DPRK friendship which was provided and developed by Chairman Mao Zedong and President Kim Il Sung has overcome all ordeals and displayed great vitality, he said.
					
					 He was pleased with the fact that the army and the people of the DPRK are making great progress in accomplishing the cause of state building under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the army and people of heroic Korea would register greater success.

articles.title: CPLA Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
CPLA Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the CPLA General Political Department, Tuesday visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Being briefed on the glorious revolutionary history of the President and members of the Mangyongdae family, the members of the delegation looked round historic relics preserved in their original state at his old home.
					
					 They had a photo taken in commemoration of their visit to the old home and looked round revolutionary relics on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 Li Jinai made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Austrian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Austrian Ambassador

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Martin Sajdik, outgoing Austrian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: Diplomatic Envoys Here Visit Industrial Establishments
articles.content:
Diplomatic Envoys Here Visit Industrial Establishments
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys in the DPRK Tuesday visited Taedonggang Pig Farm, Taedonggang Terrapin Farm, Taedonggang Net-weaving Factory and the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory.
					
					They were briefed on the successful construction of the farms and factories under the deep care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il before going around different production processes.
					
					 At the end of the tour they made entries in the visitor's book. 
					
					 German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, wrote that the visit helped him know well about the advantages of socialism and wished the Korean people success in the building of a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					 Edward Pietrzyk, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, expressed belief that those farms and factories will make great contribution to improving the living standard of the Korean people. 
					
					 Chhorn Hay, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK, noted that he became to know well about the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Haissam Saad, charge d' affaires ad interim of Syrian embassy here, noted that Kim Jong Il saw to it that excellent establishments were built for the people, adding they are of world-level and that science and technology of the DPRK are developing by leaps and bounds.

articles.title: Korean Youth League Delegation Comes Back Home
articles.content:
Korean Youth League Delegation Comes Back Home
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League headed by Kil Chol Hyok, secretary of its Central Committee, came back home by air on Tuesday after attending the 18th Congress of the World Federation of Democratic Youth in Portugal.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK marked the 50th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "The Duty of Mothers in the Education of Children".
					
					 The work, published at the national meeting of mothers on Nov. 16, Juche 50(1961), comprehensively clarifies the tasks and ways to educate and bring up children in a revolutionary manner by enhancing the mothers' responsibilities as well as the importance of the work of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK).
					
					 A meeting to mark the work took place at the Women's Hall on Tuesday.
					
					 Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the DWUK, in her report recalled that Kim Il Sung wisely led the work for revolutionizing and working-classizing women in every period and at every phase of the developing revolution and bringing up the future generations to be dependable successors to the cause of Juche.
					
					The portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung has been shining more brightly thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il, she stressed, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Il made sure that the second and third national meetings of mothers were held in a big way even at a time when the Korean revolution was undergoing difficulties, thus putting forward those mothers who devoted themselves to the education of their children and the building of a rich and powerful country. He showed great loving care and benevolence for them.
					
					 The reporter called on all the women and mothers to devote patriotic enthusiasm to the struggle for the country's prosperity and successfully bring up their children to be pillars of Songun Korea true to the Songun idea and leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Attending the meeting were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, officials of the C.C., the DWUK, and exemplary women.

articles.title: DPRK Defeats Japan in Football Match
articles.content:
DPRK Defeats Japan in Football Match   
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A match took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang on Tuesday between the DPRK and Japan belonging to Group C of the Asian regional third-stage preliminaries for the 2014 FIFA World Cup. 
					
					 The DPRK won the match 1:0.

articles.title: DPRK Wins Football Match with Japan
articles.content:
DPRK Wins Football Match with Japan 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK defeated Japan in a Group C match of the Asian regional third-stage preliminaries for the 2014 FIFA World Cup, which took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Tuesday. 
					
					 The stadium was crowded with spectators.
					
					 The two teams had a hot match as expected by football experts.
					
					 The DPRK team launched unilateral attacks in the first half of the match.
					
					 It missed a good opportunity to score a goal at around 23rd minute after the kick-off.
					
					 At around 4th minute in the second half the DPRK team opened the score by heading the ball into the net.
					
					 The match ended 1:0.
					
					 After the end of the match, Zaccheroni Alberto, senior coach of the Japanese team, told KCNA that the DPRK team is stronger than the Japanese team in spirit and courage.
					
					 Yun Jong Su, senior coach of the DPRK team, expressed satisfaction over the results of the match, saying his team could win the match with courage and confidence given by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Autumn Commodity Fair Opens in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Autumn Commodity Fair Opens in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The 2011 Autumn Commodity Fair was opened at the Pyongyang Underground Shop with due ceremony on Tuesday.
					
					 Presented to the fair were more than 2,043,600 pieces of 500 odd kinds of products from Pyongyang and various provinces.
					
					 Light industrial establishments in the city of Pyongyang turned out many quality essential foodstuff, confectionery and daily necessities. Among them are the Essential Foodstuff Factory, Cornstarch Factory, Cosmetics Factory and Daily Necessities Factory.
					
					 South and North Hwanghae, South Phyongan, Jagang and other provinces displayed agricultural products, seafood, wooden ware, grasswork, etc. produced with rich raw materials and resources available in localities.
					
					 Attending at the opening ceremony were Vice-Premier Ri Mu Yong, officials concerned and commercial officials and workers from Pyongyang and different provinces.
					
					 Minster of Commerce Kim Pong Chol made an opening address.

articles.title: Korean Stamp Exhibition Hall
articles.content:
Korean Stamp Exhibition Hall

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The Korean Stamp Exhibition Hall, located in Changgwang Street in Pyongyang, was opened in September Juche 92 (2003).
					
					 The hall, with a total floor space of several hundred square meters, displays more than 5 700 kinds of postage stamps which have been issued since the founding of the DPRK.
					
					 They include the DPRK's first stamp "Samson Rock" published on March 12, Juche 35 (1946) and stamps showing the long history, culture, customs, nature, geography, animals, plants, and physical culture of Korea and international events, as well as various sorts of souvenir envelopes, postcards and cards. 
					
					 Trophies, medals and diplomas won at international stamp contests are also displayed in the hall. 
					
					 The hall hosts stamp expositions every year and gives services like stamp introduction and sale.
					
					 The hall is always crowded with local people, overseas Koreans and foreigners.

articles.title: Kimchi-making Season in Korea
articles.content:
Kimchi-making Season in Korea
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- All households of Korea are now busy with preparing kimchi for winter.
					
					 Cabbages and radishes, principal materials of kimchi, are trucked to houses.
					
					 Kimchi making is one of the most important preparations for winter in Korea. So, it is considered a preparation of half-yearly food.
					
					 When making kimchi, Koreans help with each other among neighbors.
					
					 Included in winter kimchi are unsliced cabbage pickles, hot pickles of chopped radishes and pickled sliced radishes.
					
					 Cabbages and radishes, mixed with red pepper, Welsh onion, garlic, ginger, pear, chestnut, fish and pickled fish, are fermented by lactic bacteria. They are abundant in Vitamin C.
					
					 Kimchi, one of the Koreans' traditional dishes, is well known in the world.

articles.title: Korean People's Traditional Foodstuffs Made with Beans
articles.content:
Korean People's Traditional Foodstuffs Made with Beans 

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- From ancient times, the Korean people have used beans in preparing essential foodstuffs like soy sauce, bean paste and peppered bean paste.
					
					 The foodstuffs are diverse in raw materials and preparing methods but their main raw material is bean. 
					
					 The Korean nation began cultivating beans in the late period of the primitive ages to feed cattle, horse and other domestic animals. They found that animals liked to eat boiled beans covered with mold. So they began making bean paste after fermenting boiled beans.
					
					 Each household had its own method of preparing soy sauce and bean paste.
					
					 With red pepper being cultivated in the period of Ri Dynasty they began making peppered bean paste mixed with glutinous rice, meat and other things.
					
					 Soy sauce, bean paste and peppered bean paste are indispensable foodstuffs for Koreans.

articles.title: Ginkgo Tree in Mt. Ryongak
articles.content:
Ginkgo Tree in Mt. Ryongak
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A 500-odd-year-old ginkgo tree stands near Popun Temple in Mt. Ryongak, one of the scenic spots in the capital city of Pyongyang.
					
					 The tree is 28 meters high, 3.7 meters round at the bottom and 16.5 meters in its crown.
					
					 It has three trunks in the lower part and the trucks are ramified into many branches at the height of 2.5 meters, forming a broom-shaped crown.
					
					 The trunks are 1.8 meters, 2 meters and 1.7 meters round respectively in the middle.
					
					 It has been told that three youngsters planted three ginkgo trees as a token of swearing to be brothers, when they were visiting the temple.
					
					 The three trees had grown into one to be listed as a national treasure.

articles.title: Sangwon Oak Tree
articles.content:
Sangwon Oak Tree
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Sangwon oak tree, registered as a national treasure, grows in Taedong-ri, Sangwon County, North Hwanghae Province.
					
					 The tree, which was planted in around 1,800, is 11.7 meters high, 2.6 meters round at the bottom, 2.3 meters in the middle and 14 meters in the crown.
					
					 It is ramified into two big branches at the height of 2.2 meters and five branches again to form a crown like a broad umbrella.
					
					 Its bark is black gray and egg-shaped acorns ripen in around September and October.

articles.title: Koguryo Town in Japan
articles.content:
Koguryo Town in Japan
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- There is Koguryo town in Saitama Prefecture, Japan.
					
					 Yak Kwang, a royal family member of Koguryo kingdom (277 B.C.-668 A.D.), went to Japan as an envoy but stayed there with the kingdom going down in 668. He gathered exiles and ruined people from Koguryo near Tokyo and settled down there. 
					
					 At that time people from Koguryo, Paekje and Silla were welcomed in Japan as they taught Japanese people how to ride horse and do farming and greatly influenced them in architectural and fine art development.
					
					Populated by Koguryo people, the area turned into a granary. 
					
					After the death of Yak Kwang, the villagers built Koryo Shrine for him. The shrine is still preserved there.
					
					 They have usually abbreviated Koguryo to Koryo.
					
					 In Koguryo town schools, post office, mountain, mountain pass, buildings and railway stations were all named after Koryo. -0-
					
					 Many historic relics still remain around Koryo Shrine.

articles.title: Actions against FTA Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against FTA Staged in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Large-scale actions were staged in south Korea on Nov. 13 to check the conclusion of the humiliating "Free Trade Agreement" with the U.S.
					
					More than 20,000 workers affiliated to the Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally in plaza of the Seoul City Office.
					
					 They deplored that workers are now suffering bitterer misery and people's vital rights are being wantonly violated while the big businesses get the greatest benefit ever in history.
					
					 To make matters worse, the authorities seek to conclude the FTA with the U.S., reducing the people's life into a tighter corner, they said.
					
					 All-out fight with the "government" is inevitable if it persists in the FTA conclusion, they said, warning: The workers, in solidarity with all forces sharing the same intention, will rise up in the struggle to get the "Grand National Party" disbanded and force the "government" to step down in case the FTA destroying the future of the population is railroaded.
					
					 Read out at the rally was a resolution on concentrating all efforts on the struggle against the FTA conclusion.
					
					 Then, an all-people candlelight rally against the FTA took place in the plaza under the sponsorship of the Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. FTA. Attending it were tens of thousands of people of different strata including workers from across south Korea and lawmakers from opposition parties.

articles.title: Unity of Progressives Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Unity of Progressives Called for in S. Korea 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification on Sunday made public a statement calling for unity of the progressive forces. 
					
					 Forty-one years have passed since Jon Thae Il burnt himself to death in protest against the U.S. colonial plunder and the exploitation by the dictatorial rule, it said, adding: 
					
					 At that time his resistance spirit helped the workers unite with each other and enhanced the solidarity among the people from all walks of life.
					
					 Only the united struggle can break the chains of reaction. 
					
					 The working class and all other progressive forces should unite in do-or-die spirit through practical actions for independence, democracy and reunification to form a grand alliance against the conservative. 
					
					 Victory is in store as long as there is united might of the broad masses.

articles.title: Unreasonable Education Policy Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Unreasonable Education Policy Protested in S. Korea
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- University teachers of education-related organizations in south Korea called a press conference on Nov. 11 at which they made public a declaration on the situation in protest against the authorities' unreasonable education policy. They included the Council of Professors for Democracy, Professors Trade Union, Council of Scientific Organization and the Part-time Professors Trade Union.
					
					 The declaration said that universities are following in with the authorities' policy for commercializing education, being downgraded to business centers for training job-seekers.
					
					 Students lack courage to deeply explore the truth and teachers have become specialized in giving lectures on employment competition, it deplored, adding:
					
					 This development is attributable to the present "government."
					
					 It demanded the authorities enforce proper education policy.

articles.title: Korean Exhibition Held in Russia
articles.content:
Korean Exhibition Held in Russia
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A Korean book, photo and fine art exhibition was opened with due ceremony in Serpukhov City, Moscow Region of Russia, on Nov. 10.
					
					On display in the venue of the exhibition were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on Kim Jong Il's Songun leadership feats, books and pictures introducing the brilliant history of Songun Korea and its development and fine art works associated with wisdom and talent of the Korean people.
					
					 The curator of the History and Fine Art Museum in Serpukhov City made an opening address at the ceremony.
					
					 The DPRK has achieved world-startling successes in all fields including politics, economy, military affairs and culture under the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il, the curator said, and went on:
					
					 The exhibition will help the Serpukhov citizens know well about the army and people of the DPRK who are closely united around their leader, deeply respecting and faithfully following him.
					
					 We wish the Korean people fresh success in their efforts to achieve the country's prosperity under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants watched Korean films "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu" and "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Enhancing Women's Role
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Enhancing Women's Role
						

					 Beijing, November 14 (KCNA) -- Chinese Vice-President Xi Jinping on Wednesday called for enhancing the women's role. 
					
					 Addressing the opening ceremony of the International Forum "Woman and Sustainable Development" held at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, he said that women are a powerful driving force of the civilization and advance of humankind.
					
					  With no progress of women's work, it is impossible to make a progress of the whole society, and without world women's active participation, it is impossible to achieve a sustainable development of human society, Xi said.
					
					 China is ready to join other countries to encourage women to strive to win a durable peace and build a harmonious world, he added.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Improving Fire Prevention Capacity
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Improving Fire Prevention Capacity 

					 Beijing, November 14 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, minister of Public Security of China, recently called for increasing the fire prevention capacity throughout the country.    
					
					 Speaking at a meeting with firemen in Beijing, he said it is necessary for the protection of people's lives and properties to carry forward fine traditions in the fire-fighting field and steadily improve fire prevention capacity, based on the popular masses.
					
					 Specially, it is important to honestly implement General Secretary Hu Jintao's call for faithfully and devotedly serving the people, he added.

articles.title: Cooperation between China and Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation between China and Different Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- China and Russia on Nov. 11 adopted documents on cooperating with each other in joint border inspection.
					
					 That day China and Vietnam agreed to expand cooperation in the publishing sectors.

articles.title: Irrigation Pushed forward in Liaoning Province, China
articles.content:
Irrigation Pushed forward in Liaoning Province, China
						

					 Beijing, November 14 (KCNA) -- Liaoning Province, China is directing big efforts to the irrigation.
					
					 It set a goal to increase irrigated areas to 971,000 mu and farmlands to which water-saving technology is introduced to 444,000 mu for three years to come. It is pushing forward the work to carry out the goal.

articles.title: Iran Not to Change Path due to Western Pressures: Parliament Speaker
articles.content:
Iran Not to Change Path due to Western Pressures: Parliament Speaker
						

					 Tehran, November 14 (KCNA) -- Iran's Majlis (parliament) Speaker Ali Larijani said Thursday that Iran will never change its path in the face of western pressures.
					
					 The U.S. and other Western countries are blaring that they would apply additional sanctions on Iran after the International Atomic Energy Agency published a false report on Iran's nuclear program. In this regard the speaker said Iran will never abandon its nuclear program for peaceful purpose.
					
					 Military threat or sanctions will never make the Iranians surrender, he noted, adding the army and people of Iran will resist any pressure.

articles.title: Iran's FM Rejects IAEA Report
articles.content:
Iran's FM Rejects IAEA Report 

					 Tehran, November 14 (KCNA) -- Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast in a recent interview with a TV rejected the unreasonable report of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) on Iran's nuclear program.
					
					 He said the new report of IAEA is in line with U.S. allegations that Iran is after nuclear weapons.
					
					 He noted that the latest IAEA report on Iran evidently reveals the political goals and pressures of certain countries trying to wage a psychological war on Iran.
					
					 The report greatly damaged the nuclear agency's reputation and downgraded it to a tool at the hands of certain Western states, he added.

articles.title: Iran Will Never Compromise in Nuclear Issue:FM
articles.content:
Iran Will Never Compromise in Nuclear Issue:FM

					 Tehran, November 14 (KCNA) -- Ali Akbar Salehi, minister of Foreign Affairs of Iran, in a recent interview with a magazine expressed the stand of Iran not to compromise in the nuclear issue.
					
					 Resolutely rejecting the report of the International Atomic Energy Agency on Iran's nuclear program, he said the nuclear issue is nothing but a pretext to weaken Iran by all means.
					
					 The allegations of the IAEA that Iran is developing nuclear weapons are not evidenced with anything and, accordingly, the agency lost the objectivity, he said.
					
					 Iran has no need to make concession but will continue pushing forward its nuclear program for peaceful purpose, he noted.

articles.title: Pakistan Calls for All SAARC Countries to Eliminate Terrorism
articles.content:
Pakistan Calls for All SAARC Countries to Eliminate Terrorism
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Pakistani Prime Minister Yousuf Raza Gilani called for all South Asia Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) countries to work together to eliminate terrorism, at the opening ceremony of the 17th SAARC Summit on Thursday.
					
					 "Terrorism presents an enormous challenge to the people and SAARC needs to work together to eliminate this menace," he said.

articles.title: Zimbabwe Reaffirms Its Commitment to Mineral Processing
articles.content:
Zimbabwe Reaffirms Its Commitment to Mineral Processing
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Zimbabwe is working hard to develop mineral processing.
					
					 The government decided to include in the mineral legislation the clauses on stopping the export of major minerals and promoting beneficiation. This is aimed at processing minerals at home and exporting them rather than exporting minerals in raw form, and thereby gaining economic benefits. This was clarified by the government on Nov. 10.

articles.title: Brazil Launches Nationwide Home Healthcare Program
articles.content:
Brazil Launches Nationwide Home Healthcare Program
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff on Tuesday launched a nationwide home healthcare program which will be completely free of charge.
					
					 The so-called "Better at Home" program is aimed at patients who are undergoing physical therapy, the elderly, people with chronic but not grave diseases and post-op patients.
					
					 The government intends to have 1,000 multidisciplinary teams and 400 support teams in the program. The teams will be formed by doctors, nurses, nursing assistants and physical therapists. Each team will be able to care for up to an average of 60 patients.

articles.title: Mass Protests Staged in Germany against Capitalism
articles.content:
Mass Protests Staged in Germany against Capitalism

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Mass protests were staged simultaneously in Berlin and other major cities of Germany on Nov. 12 against exploitation and oppression by capital.
					
					 Some 8,000 demonstrators formed a long human chain around the German Parliament building Reichstag, the Central Railway Station and other landmark buildings in downtown Berlin.
					
					 They strongly demanded the authorities put an end to speculation of the banks and dissolve the financial monopolies.

articles.title: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf Reelected Liberian President
articles.content:
Ellen Johnson Sirleaf Reelected Liberian President
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Ellen Johnson Sirleaf was reelected president of Liberia.
					
					 He won a landslide victory in the recent presidential elections, the National Election Committee announced on Nov. 10.

articles.title: Almazbek Atambayev Elected Kyrgyz President
articles.content:
Almazbek Atambayev Elected Kyrgyz President

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Almazbek Atambayev was elected president of Kyrgyzstan.
					
					 He won a landslide victory in the recent presidential elections, the Central Election Committee (CEC) announced on Saturday.

articles.title: Japan Gov't Debt at Record-High 954 Tril. Yen
articles.content:
Japan Gov't Debt at Record-High 954 Tril. Yen
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government's outstanding debt increased to a record 954.42 trillion yen ($12.28 trillion) as of the end of September, the Finance Ministry of Japan said Thursday.
					
					 The figure marked a 1.1 percent increase from three months earlier.

articles.title: Flood Damage in Southeast Asian Countries
articles.content:
Flood Damage in Southeast Asian Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Flood accompanied by heavy rains which started in Southeast Asian countries four months ago caused heavy human and material damage.
					
					 Nearly 1,000 persons were killed and about 9 million others suffered in Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam and other regional countries as of Nov. 10.
					
					 529 persons were killed and 23-33 billion U.S. dollar worth of material losses was caused in Thailand, in particular. Those countries are taking steps to eradiate the aftermath of damage.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits New Zealand
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits New Zealand
						

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A 5.0-magnitude quake hit Kermadec Islands, New Zealand on Nov. 13.
					
					 The epicenter was 78.80 km deep in the sea around the islands.

articles.title: U.S. Trade Deficit
articles.content:
U.S. Trade Deficit 

					 Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- The U.S. deficit in global trade of goods and services in September reached $43.11 billion, the Commerce Department said Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje al presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje al presidente sirio 
						

					Pyongyang, 15 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 15 un mensaje de felicitacion a Bashar al-Assad, secretario regional del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe (BAAS) y presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, con motivo del 41o aniversario del Movimiento de Rectificacion en este pais.
					
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Hago llegarle a Vd. y al amistoso pueblo arabe sirio mis calidas felicitaciones en ocasion del 41o aniversario del Movimiento de Rectificacion en Siria.
					
					Ese movimiento desarrollado bajo la guia de Su Excelencia Hafez Al-Assad fue un acontecimiento de importancia historica en la lucha del pueblo sirio por construir una nueva sociedad prospera. 
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para desear exitos a Vd. y al gobierno de vuestro pais en sus trabajos para defender la soberania, la seguridad y la estabilidad del pais.
					
					Le deseo de todo corazon a Vd. buena salud y felicidad y al pueblo arabe sirio incesante progreso y prosperidad.

articles.title: En Pyongyang la delegacion militar de alto rango del EPLCh
articles.content:
En Pyongyang la delegacion militar de alto rango del EPLCh
						

					Pyongyang, 15 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Llego el dia 15 por avion particular a esta capital la delegacion militar de alto rango del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh) encabezada por Li Jinai, miembro de la Comision Militar Central del Partido Comunista de China y director del Departamento Politico General del EPLCh.
					
					La delegacion esta compuesta por el teniente general Ding Jiye, subdirector del Departamento Logistico General del EPLCh, el teniente general Chen Xiaogong, subcomandante de las fuerzas aereas, el teniente general Wang Dengping, comisario politico de la Flota del Mar Norte de las fuerzas navales, el teniente general Zhao Zongqi, jefe del Estado Mayor de la Zona Militar de Jinan, el mayor general Kan Likui, subdirector del departamento de operacion del Estado Mayor General, el mayor general Ci Guowei, subdirector de la Oficina de Asuntos Exteriores del Ministerio de Defensa Nacional, el mayor general Li Fengshan, subsecretario general de la Oficina General del Departamento Politico General y otros generales y oficiales.
					
					La acogieron en el aeropuerto los generales y oficiales del Ejercito Popular de Corea, el embajador y el agregado militar de la embajada de la Republica Popular China en Corea.
					
					Tuvo lugar frente al Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria la ceremonia para dar bienvenida a la delegacion militar de China.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes la delegacion militar china, el embajador Liu Hongcai, el agregado militar Sun Yanfeng y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica china acreditada en nuestro pais.
					
					Tambien participaron Kim Jong Gak, miembro de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, el general de ejercito Pak Jae Gyong y otros generales y oficiales del EPC.
					
					Kim Jong Gak y Li Jinai pasaron revista a la guardia de honor del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					La militar coreana y una mujer de la embajada china entregaron ramos florales a Li Jinai.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones militares de Corea y China
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones militares de Corea y China
						

					Pyongyang, 15 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 15 en esta capital en un ambiente camaraderil y amistoso las conversaciones de la  delegacion militar del Ejercito Popular de Corea (EPC) y la de alto nivel del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh).
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el miembro de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC Kim Jong Gak, el general de ejercito Pak Jae Gyong y otros generales y oficiales del EPC, y por la china, el miembro de la Comision Militar Central del Partido Comunista de China y director del Departamento Politico General del EPLCh Li Jinai, el teniente general Ding Jiye, subdirector del Departamento Logistico General, el teniente general Chen Xiaogong, subcomandante de las fuerzas aereas, y otros generales y oficiales, del EPLCh, el embajador chino Liu Hongcai y el agregado militar de la embajada china en Corea, Sun Yanfeng.
					
					  Ambas partes intercambiaron opiniones de fortalecer mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los ejercitos de los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Seleccion coreana vence a la japonesa
articles.content:
Seleccion coreana vence a la japonesa

					Pyongyang, 15 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung la competencia entre la seleccion coreana y la japonesa pertenecientes al grupo C de las eliminatorias de tercera etapa de la region asiatica para ganar el boleto a la Copa Mundial 2014 de la FIFA.
					
					El once coreano vencio al japones por 1:0.
